results.name: Cross-Session Recall
results.description: Validates semantic recall of policy decisions across sessions with paraphrased queries

steps.description: Session 1 (Tuesday): User states language constraint with decision record ID and nonce

response.response:
Grounded in project memory (12 snippets).

Okay, got it. Based on the details provided in Decision Record DR-014 (Nonce Q7F3): 1. The project team has made a final decision to use Java only and rejected the use of Python for this integration project. [ID: msg_1768254496035, msg_1768254499923] 2. This decision is recorded in DR-014 and the team has explicitly stated that this decision should not be re-opened. [ID: msg_1768254543066] The implications are that the project is committed to using Java as the sole programming language for this integration effort, and any attempts to reconsider Python would go against the established decision.

memoryCards.label: msg_1768254543066
memoryCards.content:
[Flow:general] User: Decision Record DR-014 (Nonce Q7F3): We rejected Python for this integration project. We must use Java only. Do not re-open this decision.
Assistant: Grounded in project memory (11 snippets).

Okay, got it. Here are the key points based on the decision record: 1. The project team has firmly decided to use Java as the only programming language for the integration project, rejecting the use of Python. 2. This decision is recorded in Decision Record DR-014 with nonce Q7F3, and the team has explicitly stated that this decision should not be re-opened. Implications:
- The integration layer of the project will be implemented entirely in Java, without the use of Python.
- This decision likely reflects technical, architectural or other strategic considerations that led the team to standardize on Java for this integration work.
- Reopening this decision would go against the stated directive and require significant justification. This decision appears to be a final and non-negotiable one for the integration project, as indicated by the instruction not to re-open it. The team has made a clear choice to use Java exclusively, rejecting Python as an option.

memoryCards.label: msg_1768254490860
memoryCards.content:
[Flow:general] User: Decision Record DR-014 (Nonce Q7F3): We rejected Python for this integration project. We must use Java only. Do not re-open this decision.
Assistant: Grounded in project memory (11 snippets).

Okay, based on the additional context provided in Decision Record DR-014, I can summarize the key points:
1. The project team has decided to use Java exclusively for the integration project and rejected the use of Python. [#1]
2. The decision to use Java only and reject Python for this integration project is final and should not be re-opened. [#2] IMPLICATIONS:
- The project will be implemented using Java as the sole programming language for the integration layer. This decision was likely made to ensure consistency, maintainability, and ease of integration across the different components of the system.
- Rejecting Python means the team will not be able to leverage any existing Python-based tools or libraries that may have been beneficial for this project. However, the decision was likely made after careful evaluation of the trade-offs. Since you asked me not to re-open this decision, I will respect that and not provide any further suggestions or commentary on potentially revisiting the choice of programming language. The team has made a final determination to use Java exclusively for the integration project.
